themes.rationale: The text contains numerous lacunae and bracketed reconstructions, indicating it is a fragmentary survival of the original inscription.

rationale: This inscription is an Athenian honorary decree for Strombichos, dating to 282/1 BC. It recognizes his military contributions, specifically his participation in the siege of the Mouseion hill alongside the Athenian people. As a reward for his loyalty and service during the war, the decree grants him a golden crown and Athenian citizenship, including the right to be enrolled in a tribe, deme, and phratry of his choice, subject to a judicial scrutiny (dokimasia).
